text: Captain Jerry Roberts MBE (Raymond C. Roberts) (18 November 1920 – 25 March 2014) was a British businessman and wartime codebreaker. During World War II, Roberts was worked as a codebreaker at Bletchley Park from 1941 to 1945. He was a leading codebreaker and linguist, who worked on Tunny — Hitler's most top-level code. He was born in Wembley, Middlesex. Robert died on 25 March 2014, aged 93. ==References== ==Books by him== * * Category:1920 births Category:2014 deaths Category:British people of World War II Category:English businesspeople Category:People from Middlesex Category:Spies
title: Jerry Roberts
